title: Jami Puustinen
text:
Jami Petteri Puustinen (born 9 January 1987) is a <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who plays as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> for <a href="FC%20Haka">FC Haka</a>. Born in <a href="Espoo">Espoo</a>, Puustinen began his career with <a href="FC%20Kasiysi">FC Kasiysi</a> at the age of eight in 1995, before signing for <a href="FC%20Espoo">FC Espoo</a> in 2000. After going on trial with <a href="Manchester%20United%20F.C.">Manchester United</a> in July 2003, Puustinen attracted attention from several big European clubs, before signing a three-year contract with United on 29 September 2003. However, Puustinen never made a senior appearance for Manchester United and he was released in January 2006. He then returned to Finland to sign for newly promoted FC Honka.
After the <a href="2011%20Veikkausliiga">2011 season</a> his contract with Honka expired and he became a free agent. On 21 February 2012 it was announced that Puustinen had signed a 1+1 year contract with fellow Finnish team, <a href="FC%20Haka">FC Haka</a>.
Puustinen was a regular member of the <a href="Finland%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Finland national under-21 football team</a>.
